definitions.definition: The act of moving; a movement .
examples: A slight move of the tiller, and the boat will go off course.
The drummer Cynthia praised her best friends' dance moves to the music.

definitions.definition: An act for the attainment of an object ; a step in the execution of a plan or purpose .
examples: He made another move towards becoming a naturalized citizen.

definitions.definition: A formalized or practiced action used in athletics, dance, physical exercise, self-defense, hand-to-hand combat, etc.
examples: She always gets spontaneous applause for that one move .
He can win a match with that one move .

definitions.definition: The event of changing one's residence .
examples: The move into my fiancé's house took two long days.
They were pleased about their move to the country.
I am worried about our boss's move .
It was a smart move to bring on a tall striker to play against the smaller defenders.

definitions.definition: A transfer , a change from one employer to another.
The act of moving a token on a gameboard from one position to another according to the rules of the game.
examples: The best move of the game was when he sacrificed his rook in order to gain better possession.
It's your move ! Roll the dice!
If you roll a six, you can make two moves .

definitions.definition: A round , in which each player has a turn .
examples: You can win in three moves if you do that.
definitions.label_groups: board games , usually in the plural

definitions.definition: Within the Minimalist Program, a fundamental operation of syntactic construction

main_definition: The act of moving; a movement .
